Articles.Content:
Hey, this is my attempt at making an F-22 Raptor in Ksp all stock.

To use missiles just use key bindings 0; 9; 8.

If you don't want to use SAS just trim about half of a Notch up or down depending on if you have your missiles or not.

F-22 Raptor.

http://imgur.com/kQE7KkX

Missiles!

http://imgur.com/HElIOp5

Video of it flying.

Download:

http://www./view/idx0vtat3r0m5ud/F22.craft

Edited February 20, 2014 by Khrynn
Forgot trim

Nice one!

Air intakes are most problematic thing in this craft. I think that you could use Ram Air-intake. It would look much better.

Other thing, why for you used fuel ducts?
For some reason the fuel was not being taken from the other fuel tanks, it was only being taken from the fuel tanks directly connected to the engines, i do like the idea of Ram Air-intakes though!

Not big enough.

The F-22 is a pretty big aircraft, about the same size as a F-15C Eagle. Right now the scale of that one is about the size of a F-35, or even a F/A-18A Hornet.

The engines you are using are good, but they are horrible for anything at supersonic speeds is what the F-22 was built for.

Nice looking plane though.

It is hard to make good scaled aircraft with stock parts, so I don't see anything wrong with size of craft.

F-22 was build to be stealth, high manueverable, multirole. Just to be high performance fighter as every 5th generation aircraft. His speed is awesome too, but it's not his main asset.

However there is way to improve this craft speed at high altitude and don't break his low altitude speed

Edited February 20, 2014 by Mareczex333

I agree, there is a way to improve the craft's high altitude performance without getting rid of the jet engines. Use an inverted small square strut to mount a pair of the larger jet engines right in front of the smaller so that the smaller ones are inside the larger (that's the way to do it without the console cheats). As to the size, Hodo was right. That's not to say this isn't a nice craft, it is. It's just a little on the small size for a raptor.

Yes, I know that it should be bigger, but I think that it's not so important when building stock replicas.

My F-22 Raptor is sized correctly, but I got more experiance with building than Khrynn (I think so), so I think that his replica is not so bad for now. He will gain more experiance, find better building techniques and start to correct his crafts. Now making good shape, tomorrow correct size

I agree he'll get better as he designs more, Mareczex333. I also agree that it wasn't a bad first or second try, my first stock replica wasn't any better. I just also agree that it's to small and that he needs to work on that.
f-22 and other planes is so hard to make with stock parts,Wish we could be able to make our own custom fairings for planes,it would be awasome.

It is hard to make good scaled aircraft with stock parts, so I don't see anything wrong with size of craft.

F-22 was build to be stealth, high manueverable, multirole. Just to be high performance fighter as every 5th generation aircraft.

F-22 was build to be an air superiority aircraft, i.e. a pure fighter. The multirole part was added later. And the airplane really suck at it : it is too fast for troop support and as a bomber it does not cary enough payload to achieve any tactical result, and I'm not even talking about any possible strategic result.

The whole generation thing is purely marketing. Mainly because so-called 5th generation airplane do not achieve anything more than "legacy" machines.

Stealth is pure propaganda, as are beyond visual range missiles.

Still, the plane is not that bad since it is really agile and don't loose much energy while turning, and that make it good at dogfights.

F-22 was build to be an air superiority aircraft, i.e. a pure fighter. The multirole part was added later. And the airplane really suck at it : it is too fast for troop support and as a bomber it does not cary enough payload to achieve any tactical result, and I'm not even talking about any possible strategic result.

The whole generation thing is purely marketing. Mainly because so-called 5th generation airplane do not achieve anything more than "legacy" machines.

Stealth is pure propaganda, as are beyond visual range missiles.

Still, the plane is not that bad since it is really agile and don't loose much energy while turning, and that make it good at dogfights.

I just wanted to say, that it wasn't builded, just to be very fast...

I don't know much about real aircrafts. Building them in KSP is my hobby.

Building them in KSP is my hobby.

Your aircraft looks good. I did not mean to critizise your work, sorry.
